Reviews.Title: This Polaroid camera is a beaut!
Reviews.Author: Camera Maven
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a pocket-sized camera to replace a larger camera which, I was told, would cost $250 to repair due to a faulty battery pack. Came across this Polaroid i1036, compared it with other similar cameras, and decided that this was a great buy. When received, I put it through all the paces, testing it under all sorts of conditions which had given me problems with previous digital cameras; it passed all the tests. It starts up very speedily; it takes pictures without any delay; the functions are easy to understand; it's hard to believe that such a great camera could be manufactured at this price! I love that I'm able to toss it into my trousers pocket (or even in the pocket of my jacket) and take it with me wherever I go. The only problem I have is that, as a 6 footer, my hands are rather larger, which means that my big fingers have a tendency to miss the "on" button; but I can live with that mini-problem. Probably I'll eventually catch on concerning how to turn it on properly. Certainly 10 megapixels are more, more than I'll likely ever need.

Reviews.Title: Poloroid I1036 Digital Camera--Bang For The Buck!
Reviews.Author: Idol Hanz "Idol Hanz"
Reviews.Content: I waited too long to replace the old Fuji 1.5 mega pixel camera I bought in Japan in 1999 for $99. The Polaroid I-1036 is far cheaper but it was worth waiting for. It's amazing how far the technology has come in just 10 years and how small, powerful and reliable they can make these things. The Polaroid I1036 is very small but has a lot of power and capability packed into its tiny frame. Its functions are simple and even menu navigation is simple on it. It's controls and indicators are very logically arranged so the average person could operate it without even reading the manual. In auto mode it shines. It quickly adjusts settings and quickly processes the picture so you may take another. All the enhancements and features that have been developed over the last 15 years in digital cameras seem to be there. It will record video with audio and saves it to an SD high capacity card as a .Wmv file, so it `s video format can be uploaded to YouTube or LiveLeak.. I also bought a small Polaroid Zink PoGo printer that connects easily to any camera and prints very good small photos. This Polaroid camera is feature packed, high resolution, takes great videos and seems reliable and rugged. The kind of camera you keep in your car or take with you to record anything worth taking a picture or video of!

Reviews.Title: Don't Forget a Memory Card!
Reviews.Author: Yolanda "Juice Nut"
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good, I ordered an additional memory card, had not installed it thinking there was 'some' internal memory...  There was, enough for 5 pictures.  I haven't used all the features, but the most used functions are good, quality is VERY good.  I migrated from a Kodak Easy Share and this is very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this if you need Audio!
Reviews.Author: Conradical "I love Jesus, Liberty, and things...
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a great camera for the price.The pictures are great, it is very intuitive to use.I bought it as an inexpensive way to make videos, for you-tube, family functions, etc...The audio that comes from the microphone is not worth a flip.But i did use it for some videos by syncing it up with my zoom h2 microphone.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera at good price
Reviews.Author: C'Ann Henderson "C'Ann"
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera a couple of weeks and I love it.  It's small, easy to use and pictures are good.

Reviews.Title: Seems to be a good deal
Reviews.Author: 88 keys mom "88keys mom"
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with this camera for basic photos.  I have an SLR that takes serious photos, but this one is good for my kids and takes decent photos.

Reviews.Title: great for price
Reviews.Author: B. Pirl
Reviews.Content: Got this for my daughter as an inexpensive replacement for her fancier more expensive camera that had been stolen. She loves it. Says it takes pictures and video as well as her old camera and she has had no trouble with it whatsoever. Would definitely recommend for anyone on a budget that wants a decent point and shoot/recreational type camera

Reviews.Title: Polariod i1036 Digital Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Zuckerman
Reviews.Content: I like the size of the camera.  The AA batteries have a pretty good life within the camera.  I like the speed and clarity of the pictures and the 10 Megapixals.  Great camera for such a small price-I highly recommend this product for those who want the most bang for their buck.

Reviews.Title: Very good buy, but...
Reviews.Author: siri
Reviews.Content: Very good buy, but I have to complain about the wrist strap included on package but don't received.

Reviews.Title: surprising little camera
Reviews.Author: Trini Buyer
Reviews.Content: for the price i did not expect to receive so many features.;  definitely better than the last camera i had which cost a lot more.  hope to have it for a really long time.  Oh.... and the problem that some persons reported about the power button not coming on at times.  My own works perfectly. thanks! for the speedy delivery

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: pnfire
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing for the money.  Love the pictures.  Took it on my vacation to lake arrowhead and everyone couldn't believe that this camera took such good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stu
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Being somewhat technically illiterate, all of the bells and whistles were too much at first.  I was immediately able to take great pictures even though I could not figure out all of the options.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely a great buy!
Reviews.Author: E. Barron "alphabetjungle"
Reviews.Content: The Polaroid i1036 is amazingly versatile for the money. This digital camera doesn't guzzle battery power and takes great pics. Some of the features are image stabilization, face tracking, smile detection to name a few. I haven't begun to master all the exposure options and other features available, but I'm very pleased with the pics I've taken so far of both people and objects. For example, I photographed quilts. It captured the colors well and did a wonderful job of showing the quilting on closeups. Photos of people have come out well.Users of this camera will need to purchase a memory card separately, but that is a minor expense.I highly recommend this camera for both point and shoot and those who want more features. You can't beat the price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Dana Whitmire
Reviews.Content: MORE than well worth the price for a pocket-sized point-and-shoot, this camera has LOTS of features! Advice to the amateur family photographer (like me): Take the time to read the manual included on the CD, you'll be amazed at what this camera can do!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Billy M. Ross
Reviews.Content: I shopped around and this was the best camera for the price. Shipping was prompt. I would recommend this product and supplier

Reviews.Title: Junk after three years.
Reviews.Author: John W. Hoover
Reviews.Content: Hilco Consumer Capital LP of Toronto and Gordon Brothers Brands LLC of Boston dba Polaroid sells digital cameras. At a bit under three years the lens on mine jammed causing a boot failure. It wasn't batteries, dirt, .... Internet search found numerous others with the same problem. No one knew of a workable solution. Tech support wanted more for suggestions than I paid for the camera. Polaroid doesn't offer support. About thirty screws later I got to the lens. Nothing would move. A few more screws got me into the lens. I still don't know what caused the problem. I hope my new hp camera works better.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Ian Peter Duke "IPD"
Reviews.Content: not super expensive, and so won't win any awards but my daughter paid for it with pocket money and is happy. does a decent job and can capture frames from the video portion.

Reviews.Title: Not as DESCRIBED
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine..BUT DOES NOT ACCEPT SDHC CARDS !  It will only work with a standard 2MP Card or less. WOULD NOT HAVE BOUGHT HAD I KNOWN THIS. Contacted Seller and no response

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Reyes
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a birthday present in 2009 and, so far, it still works!  The picture quality is great and it has stood up to quite a bit of abuse (it shows on my camera. LOL).  The video quality is pretty good.  All in all, a decent camera that I would recommend to others.  I love using this camera. :)

Reviews.Title: decent camera
Reviews.Content: it has held up to a lot of abuse. picture quality is amazing for the price. it does take a few seconds between taking pictures but most cameras at this price do so that is normal. easy to use and small.

Reviews.Title: High on features, very low on quality
Reviews.Author: J. Lund
Reviews.Content: I bought this cheap camera based on the relatively high reviews on Amazon. My expectations were not high, but in nearly every case, the features it has do not work well. After 5 months, it failed entirely to power on and I ended up cashing in my warranty. I really don't know if there is a decent camera out there for under $100.Picture quality:Good in ideal, sunny conditions. Tends toward cool. Does very poorly in low light. 10mp look more like 3mp when photos are viewed at 100% (lots of pixelation).Video:Sound is awful. Only useful for silent videos.Battery life:Average to low.Body/Design:Good overall. Nice and compact. Large screen area. The actual power button is poorly designed and is too small to use easily.I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Polaroid i1036
Reviews.Author: M. Wyatt
Reviews.Content: Polaroid i1036 is a wonderful purchase...compact yet takes great photos for a very fair price. Smooth transaction with seller...highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Great camera fo small price
Reviews.Author: Johan "Johan"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great digital camera but have a small budget, this is what you need!

Reviews.Title: Powerless
Reviews.Author: Wasabi
Reviews.Content: If you press the power button on a camera with new batteries, it should respond.  This one responds sometimes.  I can't tell you how many wonderful photographs have been missed because of the power button.  I have been trying to turn it for the past 3 minutes and finally got it to turn on.  I bought it last week from CompUSA, and it sucks.  Spend the extra money and get a Cybershot or a Playsport.

Reviews.Title: Not all that a great product
Reviews.Author: Shankar Venkatakrishnan "Shankar"
Reviews.Content: I really went for the price of this product, but the quality was below average for a 10 mega pixel camera. I must have bought a Sony or a Canon which were just a little more expensive than this poloroid.

Reviews.Title: New out of box, won't power on all the time.
Reviews.Author: P. Spence
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from Amazon (via Tigerdirect) for my wife for her birthday.  It was brand new, and she took it to a graduation to test it out and take pics.  The first day of use it started having problems, it would not power on with the button, it would require a battery pull in order to get it to work.  It was very inconsistent in operation.  I guess you get what you pay for.  I'm returning it to Tigerdirect and getting a better model.
